alert.note: Alert for Dent; Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 1:38AM CDT until May 16 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Dent, Shannon and Texas. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 138 AM CDT, While the heavy rain has ended, some residual flooding will likely persist into the morning hours. - This includes the following low water crossings... Big Piney River at Cleveland Road, Boone Creek at Boone Creek Road, Gladden Creek at County Road 624, Gladden Creek at Highway KK, Spring Valley at Highway N, Big Creek at County Road 390 and Little Piney River at Union Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Houston, Licking, Eminence, Summersville, Bunker, Raymondville, Huggins, Montauk, Hartshorn, Eunice, Akers, Yukon, Jadwin, Darien, Prescott, Solo, Gladden, Round Spring, Bucyrus, Simmons, Elk Creek, Turtle, Hazelton, Success, Roby, Midridge, Bendavis, Montauk State Park, Current River State Park, Echo Bluff State Park and Ozark National Scenic Riverways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
